result.execSummary:
The defendant Harrison K. Helfand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay Court costs which includeds DNA surcharge.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:   Tracy Drengburg & J.A.H. or their residence or place of employment (contact only with agent's approval).
Write letter of apology to J.A.H. and provide to agent for approval.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Domestic Abuse Assessment and Comply with recommended Treatment, if deemed appropriate by the agent.
Comply with other assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass assessment and the DOC.
Sign release forms for defendant's assessments or treatment.
Provide DNA Sample if not already done so. 
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Comply with any Restraining Orders that are currently in effect.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 6 months in jail with final 90 days to be served on electronic monitor, if approved by the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department; for work, counseling and any other reasons as deemed appropriate by the Sheriff's Dept.
Jail to commence within 60 days.
Report to Jail today for start date.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Harrison K. Helfand in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:03 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI as of August 19, 2015.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Molepske has no corrections; Atty Kryshak has no corrections.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Atty Molepske indicates victim notification had been completed; no victim's appear today in Court.
2:16 p.m.  Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 - 
Imposed Prison Sentence/Stayed - 36 months prison with 18 months confinement/18 months extended supervision 
Serve 6 months in jail with final 90 days to be served on electronic monitor if approved by the Portage County Sheriff's Department
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department; for work, counseling and any other reasons as deemed appropriate by the Sheriff's Dept.
Placed on Probation for 3 years 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:   Tracy Drengburg & J.A.H. or their residence or place of employment (contact only with agent's approval).
Write letter of apology to J.A.H. and provide to agent for approval 
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Domestic Abuse Assessment and Comply with Recommended Treatment, if deemed appropriate by the agent 
Comply with other assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass assessment and the DOC.
Sign release forms for defendant's assessments or treatment
Pay Court costs which are to include DNA surcharge 
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Provide DNA Sample if not already done so 
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Comply with any Restraining Orders that are currently in effect
Jail to commence within 60 days
Report to Jail today for start date 
44 days jail credit
Sentencing hearing at 08-25-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Harrison K. Helfand in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-188 and 15CF-49.

9:10 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 2 in 15CF-49 - recommends withheld sentence, 5 yr probation, $250 fine, dna surcharge, 10 months jail, aoda and comply, absolute sobriety, no prescription drugs without a prescription, fill all prescriptions at a single pharmacy, sign health releases for agent,  no contact with T. Drengberg or J.A.H. with DOB of 7/27/99, obtain/maintain full time employment, DAAP or parenting type class, other counseling, no dangerous weapons, DNA sample if not already submitted, and write letter of apology. Count 1 would be dismissed and read in

15CF-188: Would be dismissed and read in

Atty Kryshak concurs.
State requests a PSI based on the G Felony. There will be an argument related to jail and length of supervision.

Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST Count 2, 15CF-49.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-49: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-49 Count 2:
15CF-188: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.
PSI to be given to parties at least one week prior to sentencing.

Parties to go to Judicial Assistant for a date.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding 15CF-188 regarding preliminary hearing.

Atty Kryshak waives preliminary hearing in 15CF-188.
Defendant concurs, waives right to preliminary hearing.

Court accepts waiver.
Court is given information.
Atty Kryshak has received a copy of the information, waives reading and enters NOT GUILTY plea.

Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court amend's the cash bond to a signature bond of $2,500.00.
Defendant is to go to inpatient at Ministry and if not then he is to have a sobrieter ankle bracelet or equivalent on at all times. 
Comply with all other terms and conditions of the bond.
No contact with J.A.H. or his mother.
If no inpatient at Ministry then report to day report for 7 days per week; day report stayed at this time only if inpatient.   Once released from inpatient at Ministry then this will take effect.

Defendant Harrison K. Helfand in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Harrison K. Helfand in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion Hearing to Amend Bond.

9:38 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Court questions Atty Kryshak on his Motion.
Atty Kryshak makes statements in regarding the notification of victim's.
Court questions Atty Molepske if victim notification had been complied with.
Atty Molepske stated victim notification had been given but the actual victim's do not appear in Court today.
Atty Kryshak makes statements regarding the release of the defendant for inpatient treatment.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding the cash bond set by Judge Finn and makes additional statements; Atty Molepske opposes the motion.
Atty Kryshak makes further statements on the record.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding a PBT at the jail but was not completed.
Court makes statements regarding the behavior of the defendant.
Court questions the defendant further regarding employment;  defendant's Attorney responds.
Court questions if the defendant has any money; Atty Kryshak makes statements.

BY THE COURT: 
Court amend's the cash bond to a signature bond of $2,500.00.
Defendant is to go to inpatient at Ministry and if not then he is to have a sobrieter ankle bracelet or equivalent on at all times. 
Comply with all other terms and conditions of the bond.
No contact with J.A.H. or his mother.
If no inpatient at Ministry then report to day report for 7 days per week; day report stayed at this time only if inpatient.   Once released from inpatient at Ministry then this will take effect.

Case is back on the record 
11:50 a.m.  Court recall's the case and states the appearances.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding the sobrieter.

11:53 a.m.  Court is in recess.
to Amend Bond and Affidavit
Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harrison K. Helfand in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Harrison K. Helfand in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Case will need to be reassigned. DA/Finn
Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Harrison K. Helfand appeared by video.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Kryshak makes bond arguments to the Court.

BY THE COURT:  Victims should be given notice.  Court asks Atty Kryshak to file a motion and will have a separate hearing after they are notified.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
